abstract: Pres Obama and Chinese Pres Xi Jinping both say they will sign Paris Agreement on climate change on April 22, first day accord is available for signatures; announcement comes amid questions over whether recent Supreme Court ruling and Congressional opposition will prevent United States from meeting its obligations under treaty.
lead_paragraph: Officials cast the announcement as a statement of resolve by the world’s two largest greenhouse gas polluters, even though there are doubts about whether the United States can meet its obligations.

headline.main: Obama and President Xi of China Vow to Sign Paris Climate Accord Promptly
headline.print_headline: Obama and Chinese Leader Vow to Sign Paris Climate Agreement Promptly

snippet: Officials cast the announcement as a statement of resolve by the world’s two largest greenhouse gas polluters, even though there are doubts about whether the United States can meet its obligations.
